column2: WY DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column4: Wyoming
column6: WY

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. This sign means:
column4: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only
column6: Not enter

column2: 2. It is unlawful­ to:
column4: exceed the posted speed limit when passing.
column6: pass within 150 feet of any railroad crossing.
column8: pass within 250 feet of any intersection.

column2: 3. To avoid hydroplaning, drivers should:
column4: drive at a constant speed.
column6: slow down.

column2: 4. The first thing affected after drinking alcohol is:
column4: balance.
column6: speech.

column2: 5. The sign in the picture:
column4: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column6: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column8: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.

column2: 6. Which of the following factors affect the absorption of alcohol?
column4: Your height.
column6: Your weight.

column2: 7. When approaching a construction site, drivers should:
column4: accelerate to get out of the way quickly.
column6: slow down and adjust their driving manner.
column8: honk their horn to alert construction workers of their presence.

column2: 8. This sign tells drivers:
column4: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.
column6: they may not turn right or left during the red light.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: Yield sign ahead
column6: Side road entering from the left

column2: 10. Drivers should adjust their rearview and side mirrors:
column4: before they start driving.
column6: whenever they need to use them.
column8: before they get into the car.

column2: 11. Which statement about taking medications and driving is true?
column4: Cold medications can make a person drowsy.
column6: Over the counter drugs do not affect driving ability.
column8: Prescribed drugs are safe to take at any time.

column2: 12. A driver distraction is anything that:
column4: takes the attention away from driving.
column6: causes aggressive behavior while driving.

column2: 13. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column4: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.
column6: obey signals from crossing guards.

column2: 14. This sign indicates:
column4: Winding road. Drive with caution.
column6: Warning: drunk drivers.
column8: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 15. Your driving ability can be affected by:
column4: just one drink.
column6: at least two drinks.

column2: 16. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 17. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.
column6: signal turns, lane changes and stops.

column2: 18. ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
column4: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)
column6: Warning signs

column2: 19. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column6: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column8: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.

column2: 20. If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:
column4: make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.
column6: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.
column8: honk your horn and proceed with caution.

column2: 21. Drivers under the age of 21 are subject to a specific restriction prohibiting them from driving:
column4: before midnight.
column6: with alcohol in their system.

column2: 22. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column4: look for a detour or another route.
column6: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.

column2: 23. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column6: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
column8: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.

column2: 24. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.
column6: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.
column8: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.

column2: 25. As the percentage of alcohol in your blood (BAC) increases, you become:
column4: more reactive.
column6: more sober.

column2: 26. The extra space in front of a large truck is needed for:
column4: other drivers when they want to pass the truck.
column6: other drivers when merging onto a freeway.
column8: the truck driver to stop the vehicle.

column2: 27. If a bus needs to make a right turn and you are also turning right:
column4: squeeze between the bus and the curb.
column6: wait until the bus turns before turning right.
column8: try to turn right before the bus does.

column2: 28. Before stopping your vehicle on the roadway, drivers should:
column4: pump the brakes to check if they work properly.
column6: place their foot on the accelerator.

column2: 29. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.
column6: increase your speed immediately.
column8: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.

column2: 30. When turning, drivers should:
column4: always move to the right lane.
column6: check traffic in all directions.
column8: increase their speed to improve stability.

column2: 31. When you see this sign, you should:
column4: always stop at the crosswalk.
column6: be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.
column8: slow down, proceed with caution and watch for blind people.

column2: 32. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
column4: must interrupt
column6: must yield to

column2: 33. Parking is not allowed:
column4: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
column6: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.

column2: 34. When driving in work zones, drivers should:
column4: pass the vehicle ahead when safe.
column6: keep a safe following distance.
column8: tailgate the vehicle ahead while reducing their speed.

column2: 35. To avoid panic stops, you should:
column4: scan the road ahead for hazards.
column6: drive with your window down.
column8: pump your brakes to make sure they work.

column2: 36. A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
column4: next to the solid line may pass.
column6: next to the broken line may pass.

column2: 37. Any use of a cell phone while operating a motor vehicle is considered a distraction because:
column4: it causes the driver to be concerned about the latest news.
column6: it occupies the driver's mind, hands and eyes.
column8: it draws the attention of other drivers.

column2: 38. This road sign means:
column4: Playground ahead
column6: Pedestrian crossing

column2: 39. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.
column6: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column8: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.

column2: 40. You arrive at an intersection where you have a green light, but the path ahead is blocked, you should:
column4: enter the intersection and wait until traffic clears.
column6: stay out of the intersection until traffic clears.
column8: turn left and find another route.

column2: 41. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
column4: a crossbuck sign.
column6: a speed limit sign.

column2: 42. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
column4: parking lights.
column6: low beam headlights.

column2: 43. This road sign means:
column4: A road joins from the right
column6: There is a series of sharp turns up ahead on the road

column2: 44. When passing a pedestrian who is walking on the road and an oncoming vehicle is approaching, you should:
column4: keep driving, you have the right-of-way.
column6: honk your horn to warn the pedestrian.
column8: slow down and let the vehicle pass first.

column2: 45. Blind spots are:
column4: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that are easy to spot.
column6: areas of the road that cannot be seen even when looking into mirrors.

column2: 46. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.
column6: Drivers who are fatigued.

column2: 47. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.
column6: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.

column2: 48. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column6: enter the intersection and then stop.
column8: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.

column2: 49. Drivers turning left must yield to:
column4: None of the above.
column6: oncoming vehicles turning left.

column2: 50. As you enter a roundabout you should slow down and:
column4: yield to pedestrians and bicyclist crossing before entering the roundabout.
column6: yield to any vehicle coming from your left in the roundabout.
